data.text:
Jelly Roll is ecstatic he got to hang out with Sylvester Stallone on the Tulsa King set.

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt believe this happened,‚Äù Jelly Roll, 39, wrote via his Instagram Stories on Thursday, June 13, reposting a video Stallone, 77, shared on the social media platform that same day.

In the video, the singer and Rocky star could be seen chatting it up among crew members on the set of the Paramount series.

"I got my fourth No. 1 today, Sly," Jelly Roll said of his ‚ÄúHalfway to Hell‚Äù song, which just topped Billboard‚Äôs Country Airplay Chart. "I got my fourth No. 1 on the radio this morning."

Jelly Roll‚Äôs Family Guide: Meet His Wife Bunnie XO, Daughter Bailee Ann and Son Noah Buddy

Stallone replied with: "Fourth No. 1, unbelievable‚Äù while holding up four fingers.

"I woke up on a bus in your parking lot with my fourth No. 1,‚Äù Jelly Rolle said with a smile. ‚ÄúWhat a f‚Äîing week.

Stallone showed his support by captioning the post with a sweet message. ‚ÄúLooks like the fantastic singer @jellyroll615 just rolled onto the Tulsa King set! #KeepPunching ü•ä #TulsaKing,‚Äù he wrote.

‚ÄúHalfway to Hell‚Äù comes from Jelly Roll‚Äôs Whitsitt Chapel album, his first country music project released in June 2023, featuring collaborations with Struggle Jennings, Yelawolf, Lainey Wilson and Brantley Gilbert.

Jelly Roll and Wife Bunnie XO‚Äôs Relationship Timeline: From Las Vegas Wedding and Beyond

Jelly Roll‚Äôs other tracks to reach number on Country Airplay include ‚ÄúSave Me,‚Äù ‚ÄúNeed A Favor‚Äù and ‚ÄúSon of A Sinner.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am incredibly grateful for the overwhelming support from my fans and country radio,‚Äù Jelly Roll said of his recent success, per Music Row. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a testament to the power of music that I am here at all and I‚Äôve never been more inspired to keep creating. Thank you to everyone that has made this possible. I‚Äôm ready to share more music soon‚Ä¶very soon.‚Äù

On Wednesday, June 12, the musician released ‚ÄúI Am Not Okay‚Äù and will embark on his Beautifully Broken Tour this August.

In November 2022, Tulsa King premiered on Paramount+ with Stallone in the leading role as Dwight ‚ÄúThe General‚Äù Manfredi, a mobster released from prison and sent to Oklahoma by his crime family‚Äôs boss.

Sylvester Stallone Through the Years: From ‚ÄòRocky‚Äô to ‚ÄòThe Family Stallone‚Äô

During production, the legendary actor faced accusations of verbal abuse from an Atlanta-based casting company.

Stallone allegedly called background actors ‚Äúugly,‚Äù ‚Äútub of lard‚Äù and ‚Äúfat guy with cane.‚Äù

Tasha Walker-Carroll of The Walker Talent Management Group, however, told Us Weekly in April that she didn‚Äôt believe the accusations.
